text: Raja Issa El-Issa ( (his surname also spelt al Issa and Elissa); born 1922 in Jaffa, mandatory Palestine), was a Palestinian journalist. He completed his secondary schooling in Ramallah and then joined the American University in Beirut, Lebanon. Eleven years before his birth, his father, Issa El-Issa founded the Falastin newspaper. He died on 1 December 2008 at the age of 86 in Amman. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Eastern Orthodox Christians from Palestine Category:Palestinian journalists Category:Palestinian newspaper publishers (people) Category:People from Jaffa Category:20th-century journalists
title: Raja El-Issa
